page.title: 19A clothing factory-Riddings
page.content: The Peek-a-Boo factory makes childrens clothes. We went down to see them made. First they design the clothes. They look at catalogues and sometimes they make up their own designs. The design is then printed on paper. Then they choose the best material for the garment. One of each design is made. They take the garments to show to the shops. The shops then order the clothes they want. The material is laid on a table,a pattern is laid on top of it and the material is cut out. It is made very quickly. Each person does a different part of the garment.They are examined and checked because they might not be sewn right and there might be a stitch loose. Then the garments are put on coat hangers and sent to the warehouse.
